author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Risks to the Irish economy from US policy changes including tariffs have lowered since the beginning of 2025, according to Goodbody stockbrokers.
title: US Tariff, Tax Risks Ease for Ireland, Goodbody Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he believed the Justice Department likely owes him compensation, following a report that he was seeking some $230 million after he faced multiple federal investigations.
title: Trump Says Justice Department Likely Owes Him Money Over Probes

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Andrew Kreighbaum
description: College graduates on student visas and certain foreign workers already living in the US will not have to pay a $100,000 filing fee for H-1B visas, the Department of Homeland Security said in updated guidance outlining how the new rules will work.
title: College Grads, Some Workers in US Spared New $100,000 H-1B Fee

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Fresh off winning Sunday’s election, Bolivia’s next president Rodrigo Paz is blazing a rare centrist path out of his country’s economic crisis, focusing on practical policies over ideological divisions engulfing its neighbors.
title: Bolivia’s Next President Targets Pragmatic Path Out of Crisis

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said President Donald Trump’s administration will resume distributing $3 billion in aid from the Farm Service Agency that had been halted as a result of the three-week-long government shutdown.
title: Trump Administration to Resume Farmer Aid Halted by Shutdown

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump stressed that India would wind down its purchases of oil from Russia, claiming for the second straight week that he spoke directly about the matter with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
title: Trump Again Says Modi Agreed to Ease Russian Energy Buys

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: White House and Kremlin are at odds on further talks.
title: Trump-Putin Meeting on Ukraine Won’t Be Happening Anytime Soon

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The former Justice Department special counsel who prosecuted President Donald Trump before his reelection offered another public rebuttal to escalating Republican attacks on his work.
title: Ex-Trump Prosecutor Smith Defends Lawmaker Call Records Subpoena

author: Nojoud Al Mallees
description: Manufacturing executives say the Canadian government should take inspiration from Donald Trump’s tax cuts to help businesses remain competitive as they face cost pressures and uncertainty from US tariffs.
title: Manufacturing CEOs Want Canada to Mirror Tax Cuts in Trump’s Big Beautiful Bill

author: Miranda Davis
description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker assailed a plan by Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson to bring back a tax on large corporate payrolls, saying the proposed levy would repel major employers.
title: Pritzker Slams Chicago Mayor’s Plan for Tax on Big Payrolls

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: The US Treasury sold dollars again on Tuesday through Banco Santander in Argentina’s currency market as the peso neared the ceiling of its trading band, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.
title: Treasury Sells Dollars to Keep Argentine Peso Within FX Band

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Israeli settler violence has “skyrocketed” in the West Bank as extremists once again disrupt the economically-crucial olive harvest in Palestinian communities, a United Nations official said on Tuesday.
title: Israeli Settler Violence Skyrockets Amid Olive Harvest, UN Says

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada’s statistics agency says it hasn’t received any data on US imports of Canadian goods for September, raising the possibility that it won’t be able to proceed with a scheduled release of trade figures on Nov 4.
title: US Shutdown Leaves Canada in the Dark on Major Chunk of Exports

author: Myles Miller
description: A New York man pardoned by President Donald Trump for his role in the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the US Capitol was arrested Sunday after threatening to kill House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries.
title: Man Pardoned After Jan. 6 Arrested Over Jeffries Death Threat

author: Arne Delfs, Jorge Valero
description: Germany and France are supporting a push to discuss China’s increasingly restrictive trade measures at an EU leaders’ summit in Brussels on Thursday, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany and France Back China Trade Discussion at EU Summit

author: Joe Deaux, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is involved in talks for a US company to access one of the world’s largest untapped deposits of tungsten, a metal used by the Pentagon to make ammunition, projectiles and other weaponry.
title: Trump Team Backs Effort for US-Kazakhstan Tungsten Mine Deal

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: President Donald Trump urged Senate Republicans to hold the line as the US government shutdown extended into its 21st day, warning Democrats that they would bear the political fallout for the impasse if they did not vote quickly to approve funding.
title: Trump Tells GOP Senate to Stand Firm: ‘We Will Not Be Extorted’

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US President Donald Trump predicted an upcoming meeting with his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, would yield a “good deal” on trade — while also conceding that the highly anticipated talks may not happen.
title: Trump Sees Successful Xi Meeting, But Allows It Might Not Happen

author: Kristina Peterson
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has spent months criss-crossing the country, cheering on Republican governors who have signed laws aimed at improving their food supply.
title: Big Food Readies New Strategy Against RFK Jr. Push in States

author: Oscar Medina
description: A Colombian court overturned the conviction of former President Alvaro Uribe Velez, closing one of the most polarizing chapters in the nation’s recent history and and jolting the country’s political landscape just seven months before the presidential elections.
title: Colombia Politics Jolted as Court Overturns Uribe Conviction

author: Kate Sullivan, Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump has no plans to meet President Vladimir Putin in the immediate future, a White House official said, offering a more downbeat tone after the two sides suggested earlier that a second summit between the two leaders would happen soon.
title: White House Plays Down Prospects for Quick Putin-Trump Meeting

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Dan Williams
description: US Vice President JD Vance said he remains optimistic about the future of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas despite a flareup in violence over the weekend, part of a bid to keep talks progressing on the future of Gaza.
title: Vance Hails Progress on Gaza Peace Accord Despite Violence

author: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham, Eric Martin
description: European nations are working with Ukraine on a 12-point proposal to end Russia’s war along current battle lines, pushing back against Vladimir Putin’s renewed demands to the US for Kyiv to surrender territory in return for a peace deal.
title: Europe and Ukraine Prepare 12-Point Proposal to End Russia’s War

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump urged a judge to let him continue a $10 billion libel lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch over a Wall Street Journal article claiming he sent a bawdy birthday note to Jeffrey Epstein, saying an identical note recently handed over to the House Oversight Committee doesn’t prove it’s real.
title: Trump Says $10 Billion Libel Suit Against Murdoch Should Proceed

author: Madison Muller, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: A Senate confirmation hearing is being planned next week for Casey Means, President Donald Trump’s nominee for surgeon general who has faced criticism over her experience and views, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Senate Plans Confirmation Hearing for Surgeon General Nominee

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: Ukraine is deploying around 9,000 drones per day to fend off Russia’s ongoing assaults, according to a top Ukrainian military official, a figure that underscores just how crucial drones have become to the ongoing war.
title: Ukraine Says it Deploys About 9,000 Drones A Day to Fight Russia

author: Ben Bartenstein
description: Syria plans to start an international roadshow in the next few months to court fresh investment from Gulf states, Europe and the US, as part of an effort to rebuild its war-battered economy.
title: Syria Plans Roadshow Within Months as It Seeks Investment Boost

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Alicia Diaz
description: The Trump administration will soon roll out a “big package” intended to bolster US beef production as consumers struggle with a surge in prices, according to Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins.
title: US Plans to Open Land for Cattle Ranching as Beef Prices Soar

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The founders of private equity firm Partners Group Holding AG have taken a step closer to making it harder for Switzerland to pass a new deal to reorganize relations with the European Union.
title: Swiss Buyout Titans Make Progress in Bid to Prevent EU Deal

author: Dan Williams, Ellen Milligan
description: US Vice President JD Vance visited the base of a multinational monitoring force near Gaza as one of his first stops on a three-day trip to Israel, seeking to bolster faith in a peace plan that’s got off to an uncertain start.
title: Vance Visits US-Led Base in Israel With Gaza Truce in Balance

author: S'thembile Cele
description: A US-backed mining investor warned that Washington must outspend Beijing on critical minerals projects to challenge China’s dominance of global supply chains.
title: Mining Investor Says US Must Outspend China on Critical Minerals

author: Sam Dagher
description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is set to meet US President Donald Trump at the White House on Nov. 18 and sign agreements on artificial intelligence, defense, nuclear cooperation and trade, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince MBS to Visit Trump in November

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland seeks to discuss ArcelorMittal SA‘s plans for operations in Europe amid growing concerns over the country’s ailing steel industry.
title: Poland Plans ArcelorMittal Talks on Future of Steel Industry

author: Foster Wong
description: China convened an unusually large meeting with foreign businesses in an effort to reassure them its new export controls aren’t meant to restrict normal trade, as policymakers seek to calm a backlash over the decision.
title: China Reassures Foreign Firms on Export Controls at Huge Meeting

author: John Harney, Nicolle Yapur
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent stepped in to boost Argentina’s assets yet again on Tuesday, characterizing a $20 billion swap line signed a day earlier as an “economic stabilization” deal.
title: Argentina Bonds Climb as Bessent Seals ‘Stabilization’ Deal

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Colombian government met with the US ambassador in Bogotá in hopes of finding a “prompt solution” to a sudden diplomatic crisis that’s dented investor confidence. The Andean nation’s bonds climbed on the news.
title: Colombia and US Hold ‘Constructive’ Talks After Fresh Trump Threats

author: Julian Lee
description: Flows rose to a 29-month high in the four weeks to Oct. 19
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Climb Close to a Post-Invasion High

author: Greg Ryan
description: A millionaire levy in Massachusetts that New York City mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani holds up as a model for taxing the rich has generated $3 billion more in revenue than expected without forcing significant high-profile departures from the state.
title: Millionaire Tax That Inspired Mamdani Fuels $5.7 Billion Haul in Massachusetts

author: Thomas Buckley
description: The doubling of California’s film and TV tax credits to $750 million a year is showing promise in bringing production back to the state.
title: California’s Bigger Tax Credits Reel In ‘Jumanji,’ Warner Films

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said he’s asked Deputy Finance Minister Vorapak Tanyawong for a written response to allegations that he’s linked to Southeast Asian scam networks.
title: Thai Prime Minister Asks Deputy to Explain Scam Link Allegation

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungary extended the nation’s years-long state of emergency, ensuring that the next elections will be held under the special legal regime that’s given Prime Minister Viktor Orban wide latitude to impose his rule.
title: Hungary to Hold Next Parliamentary Election Under Emergency Rule

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan will get its first-ever female prime minister after Sanae Takaichi, a former economic security minister, won a historic parliamentary vote on Oct. 21. Her predecessor Shigeru Ishiba resigned after barely a year following a historic upper house election defeat in July, and Takaichi’s longevity as premier will depend on how swiftly she can unite her party and win back public support.
title: What Takaichi’s Historic Win as Prime Minister Means for Japan

author: Eva Brendel
description: Germany’s grid regulator and antitrust office have found no evidence of market abuse in connection with power price spikes last winter — when there were capacity curbs — though some investigations are ongoing.
title: German Watchdogs Find No Sign of Power-Price Spike Market Abuse

author: Alastair Gale
description: Sanae Takaichi wants to counter China’s efforts to reshape the global order.
title: Japan’s New Leader Is Set to Face a Trump Test

author: Alastair Gale, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, appointed just two other women to her cabinet, well below the high of five in other recent administrations but notable for her nomination of the nation’s first female finance minister.
title: Japan PM Takaichi Picks Just Two Other Women as Cabinet Members

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia said Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and US Secretary of State Marco Rubio came to no agreement on a meeting during phone talks, casting a shadow over preparations for a planned summit between their presidents aimed at ending the war in Ukraine.
title: Russia Says Lavrov and Rubio Reached No Agreement on Meeting

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile’s center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei was feted like a rockstar at the nation’s premier investor conference this month. But polls show that enthusiasm doesn’t echo much beyond the executive class looking to return the country to a moderate, pro-growth path.
title: Pro-Business Chilean Presidential Contender Trails a Communist and Right-Winger

author: Cory Bennett
description: European leaders said they “strongly support” an immediate halt to Russia’s war in Ukraine along current battle lines to start peace talks as they try to renew momentum toward ending the war.
title: Europe Leaders Back Immediate Freeze of Battle Lines in Ukraine

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Firat Kozok
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is set to visit Qatar this week with a request to buy 24 used Eurofighter Typhoon jets to modernize his country’s air force.
title: Erdogan Travels to Qatar, Seeking to Buy 24 Used Eurofighters

author: Abeer Abu Omar, Mirette Magdy
description: The International Monetary Fund is urging Egypt to speed up a long-running plan to divest from state assets, a cornerstone of an $8 billion program that helped the North African nation emerge from its worst crisis in decades.
title: IMF Urges Egypt to Accelerate Privatization Amid Reviews Talks

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: Nicolas Sarkozy entered Prison de la Santé on Tuesday morning after his conviction for criminal conspiracy last month, marking the first time a former French president goes to jail.
title: Disgraced Ex-French President Sarkozy Arrives at Paris Jail

author: Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland has detained eight individuals across the country in recent days on suspicion of preparing acts of sabotage, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said in a post on X on Tuesday.
title: Poland Detains Eight People Suspected of Sabotage, Tusk Says

author: Abeer Abu Omar, Joumanna Bercetche
description: Saudi Arabia’s fiscal and current accounts would benefit most from a rebound in oil prices and production, according to the International Monetary Fund, despite the government’s progress in diversifying the $1.2 trillion economy.
title: Oil Recovery to Determine Saudi Fiscal Trajectory, IMF Says

author: Sakura Murakami, Alastair Gale
description: Sanae Takaichi, the pro-stimulus conservative who has become Japan’s first female prime minister, is an energetic nationalist with a soft spot for the hard-nosed politics of Iron Lady Margaret Thatcher and the heavy metal music of Iron Maiden.
title: Japan Shifts to the Right Under ‘Iron Lady’ Admirer Takaichi

author: Michael Heath, Haslinda Amin
description: Australia is capable of engaging with the Trump administration while stabilizing relations with China, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said, reiterating the center-left government’s policy of balancing the fractious superpowers.
title: Australia to Manage Engagement With US and China, Treasurer Says

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Sanae Takaichi won the lower house of parliament vote to become Japan’s prime minister on Tuesday, effectively making her the first woman to clinch the nation’s top leadership job.
title: Sanae Takaichi Becomes Japan’s First Female Prime Minister

author: Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Facebook’s block on political advertising in Europe leaves elections at the mercy of Big Tech’s algorithms.
title: Meta’s Political Ad Ban Boosts Dutch Far-Right Leader

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s ruling party leader Sanae Takaichi, who is poised to become the nation’s first female prime minister, is set to tap Satsuki Katayama as the country’s first female finance minister, according to local media.
title: Japan Set to Have First Female Finance Minister, Reports Say

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi is poised to become the nation’s first female prime minister, taking on the challenges of quelling discontent over the cost of living, dealing with the Trump administration and reviving the fortunes of a ruling party that has lost its dominance at the ballot box.
title: Takaichi to Break Japan’s Glass Ceiling With Politics in Turmoil

author: Prima Wirayani
description: The Indonesian rupiah is at risk of falling to a record low as lingering concerns over the central bank’s independence sap investor confidence, according to the currency’s top forecaster last quarter.
title: Rupiah Poised for Record Low on Policy Risk, Top Forecaster Says
